newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Kexim seen launching US$500 mln global bond.
newsitem.headline: Kexim seen launching US$500 mln global bond.

text.p: The Export-Import Bank of Korea (Kexim) is expected to tap the international markets with a US$500 million global bond issue as early as this week, bankers said on Monday.
Lehman Brothers is tipped to be the lead manager.
The bond reportedly has a final maturity of 10 years with a put option on the fifth anniversary.
Bankers speculate the bond will be heavily marketed in the United States, where demand for Korean paper has remained strong despite recent troubles in the country's financial sector.
In February, Kexim launched via Morgan Stanley and Salomon Brothers a US$500 million five-year global bond.
